snippet: Stents and sutures are not an obvious fit, Jeffrey Goldfarb and Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews write, and the savings and benefits from such a merger do not appear to justify a premium of nearly $10 billion.
abstract: Stents and sutures are not an obvious fit, Jeffrey Goldfarb and Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews write, and the savings and benefits from such a merger do not appear to justify a premium of nearly $10 billion.

byline.original: By JEFFREY GOLDFARB and ROBERT CYRAN

headline.main: Medtronic-Covidien Deal Is a Marriage of Convenience
